TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpListenerPrefixCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<string>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string>, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public Class HttpListenerPrefixCollection Implements ICollection(Of String), IEnumerable(Of String)

summary.span: 表示用于存储 对象的统一资源标识符 (URI) 前缀的集合。

span.span: Represents the collection used to store Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefixes for objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性返回的此集合的实例。The property returns instances of this collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建，并将添加到用户指定的前缀其。The following code example creates an and adds user-specified prefixes to its . public: virtual void Add(System::String ^ uriPrefix);

param.name: uriPrefix
param.span: 用于标识在传入请求中比较的 URI 信息的 。

span.span: A that identifies the URI information that is compared in incoming requests.

param.span: 前缀必须以正斜杠 ("/") 结尾。

span.span: The prefix must be terminated with a forward slash ("/").

summary.span: 将统一资源标识符 (URI) 前缀添加到集合。

span.span: Adds a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefix to the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将 URI 前缀添加到由关联的前缀集对象。This method adds a URI prefix to the set of prefixes managed by the associated object. 检查时`uriPrefix`以确保它是有效，请忽略大小写。When checking `uriPrefix` to ensure it is valid, case is ignored. URI 的前缀字符串组成的方案 （http 或 https）、 主机、 一个可选端口，以及一个可选路径，例如，"`http://www.contoso.com:8080/customerData``/`"。A URI prefix string is composed of a scheme (http or https), a host, an optional port, and an optional path, for example, "`http://www.contoso.com:8080/customerData``/`". 前缀必须以正斜杠 ("/") 结尾。The prefix must be terminated with a forward slash ("/"). 最匹配所请求的 URI 的前缀与对请求作出响应。The with the prefix that most closely matches a requested URI responds to the request. 多个对象不能添加相同的前缀。Multiple objects cannot add the same prefix. 如果引发异常会添加前缀中已被使用。An exception is thrown if an adds a prefix that is already in use. 指定一个端口时，主机元素可以被替换为"`*`"，则指示接受请求发送到端口，如果请求的 URI 与任何其他前缀不匹配。When a port is specified, the host element can be replaced with "`*`" to indicate that the accepts requests sent to the port if the requested URI does not match any other prefix. 例如，若要接收所有请求发送到端口 8080 请求的 URI 都不处理时由任何其他，该前缀是"`http://*:8080``/`"。For example, to receive all requests sent to port 8080 when the requested URI is not handled by any other , the prefix is "`http://*:8080``/`". 同样，若要指定接受所有请求都发送到的端口替换主机元素"`+`"字符，"`https://+:8080`/"。Similarly, to specify that the accepts all requests sent to a port, replace the host element with the "`+`" character, "`https://+:8080`/". "`*`"和"`+`"字符可出现在包含路径的前缀。The "`*`" and "`+`" characters can be present in prefixes that include paths. 从.NET 4.5.3 和 Windows 10 开始，在 URI 的前缀中管理的支持通配符子域对象。Starting with .NET 4.5.3 and Windows 10, wildcard subdomains are supported in URI prefixes that are managed by an object. 若要指定通配符子域，使用"*"字符的 URI 前缀中的主机名的一部分： 例如， `http://*.foo.com/`，并将此作为自变量传递给 HttpListenerPrefixCollection.Add 方法。To specify a wildcard subdomain, use the "*" character as part of the hostname in a URI prefix: for example, `http://*.foo.com/`, and pass this as the argument to the HttpListenerPrefixCollection.Add method. 这将在处理.NET 4.5.3 和 Windows 10;在早期版本，此操作将产生 This will work on .NET 4.5.3 and Windows 10; in earlier versions, this would generate an ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建，并将添加到用户指定的前缀其。The following code example creates an and adds user-specified prefixes to its . [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#2)]

summary.span: 从该集合中移除所有的统一资源标识符 (URI) 前缀。

span.span: Removes all the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) prefixes from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法之后, 无法启动关联而无需添加新的前缀; 如果你尝试执行此操作，将引发异常。After calling this method, you cannot start the associated without adding new prefixes; if you try to do so, an exception is thrown. ## Examples 下面的代码示例删除中的所有前缀。The following code example removes all prefixes in an . summary.span: 返回一个可用于循环访问集合的对象。

span.span: Returns an object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

returns.span: 一个对象，它实现了 接口，并提供对此集合中的字符串的访问。

span.span: An object that implements the interface and provides access to the strings in this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回的对象最初定位在此集合中的第一个元素之前。The object that is returned by this method is initially positioned before the first element in this collection. 必须调用方法可以访问的第一个元素之前。You must call the method before you can access the first element. 若要访问当前的位置处的元素，调用属性。To access the element at the current position, call the property. 不要修改集合，同时使用枚举器。Do not modify the collection while using the enumerator. 如果在一个枚举器时修改集合的使用，试图将位置设置通过调用或导致。If the collection is modified while an enumerator is in use, an attempt to set the position by calling or causes an . 枚举器的详细说明，请参阅的文档类和方法。For a detailed description of enumerators, see the documentation for the class and the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示枚举整个集合。The following code example demonstrates enumerating through a collection. 请注意 Visual Basic 和 C# 示例使用语言特定语句用于循环访问而不是检索枚举器集合。Note that the Visual Basic and C# examples use language specific statements to enumerate through the collection instead of retrieving the enumerator. [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsSynchronized { get; }
.property instance bool IsSynchronized
Public ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean
public: property bool IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示对集合的访问是否同步（线程安全）。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread-safe).
This property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.
